title: Smallest Sufficient Team
content: In a project, you have a list of required skills , and a list of . The i-th person contains a list of skills that person has. Consider a sufficient team: a set of people such that for every required skill in , there is at least one person in the team who has that skill. We can represent these teams by the index of each person: for example, represents the people with skills , , and . Return any sufficient team of the smallest possible size, represented by the index of each person. You may return the answer in any order. It is guaranteed an answer exists. Elements of and are (respectively) distinct. are lowercase English letters. Every skill in is a skill in . It is guaranteed a sufficient team exists.
